p: Some Euphorbio plants (specifically Euphorbia resinifera) contain resiniferatoxin, a (3-4 orders of magnitude) more potent, functional analog of capsaicin. It causes severe burning pain in sub-microgram quantities when ingested orally [ 44]. Resiniferatoxin has been used in several studies for its ability to activate TRPV1 [ 45, 46, 47].
